description: Ability to use telephone for communication
independence_level_1: Operates telephone on own initiative, looks up and dials numbers
independence_level_3: Answers telephone but does not dial
dependence_level: Does not use telephone at all, requires complete assistance
clinical_significance: Early indicator of cognitive decline; requires memory and sequencing

description: Ability to shop for groceries and necessities
independence_level_1: Takes care of all shopping needs independently (transportation, selection, payment)
independence_level_3: Needs to be accompanied on any shopping trip, requires assistance
dependence_level: Unable to go shopping; completely dependent on others

independence_level_1: Plans, prepares and serves adequate meals independently
independence_level_2: Prepares adequate meals if supplied with ingredients (heating, simple assembly)
independence_level_3: Heats and serves prepared meals, cannot prepare meals from scratch
dependence_level: Unable to prepare any meals; requires meal delivery or full assistance

independence_level_1: Maintains house alone or with occasional assistance (heavy work only, e.g., moving furniture)
independence_level_2: Performs light daily tasks such as dishwashing, bed making, dusting
independence_level_3: Performs light tasks but cannot maintain acceptable level of cleanliness, needs help with all tasks
dependence_level: Unable to participate in any housekeeping tasks; requires full housekeeping assistance
Unable to do laundry; all laundry must be done by others
column14: Requires physical ability and task sequencing

independence_level_1: Travels independently on public transportation or drives own car, arranges own travel
independence_level_2: Arranges own travel via taxi, does not use public transportation
independence_level_3: Travels on public transportation when assisted or accompanied by another, limited to taxi/car with assistance
dependence_level: Does not travel at all; completely dependent on others for transportation
clinical_significance: Critical for community independence; requires navigation and judgment

independence_level_1: Takes medications in correct dosages at correct time independently, manages refills
independence_level_2: Takes medications if prepared in advance in separate dosages
independence_level_3: Unable to take medications independently; requires complete medication management
clinical_significance: Safety-critical; errors can lead to serious health consequences

independence_level_1: Manages financial matters independently (budgets, writes checks, pays rent/bills, goes to bank, collects and tracks income)
independence_level_2: Manages day-to-day purchases, but needs help with banking, major purchases, complex financial tasks
independence_level_3: Unable to handle money or financial matters; requires complete financial management assistance
clinical_significance: Requires complex executive function; vulnerability to exploitation when impaired

iadl_id: # Scale: Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) Scale
# Developers: M. Powell Lawton and Elaine M. Brody

iadl_name: Brody EM. Assessment of older people: self-maintaining and instrumental activities of daily living. Gerontologist. 1969;9(3):179-186.

iadl_id: #   Alternative: Sum of individual item scores (varies by item: some 0-1
#   Women traditionally assessed on all 8 items
#   Men traditionally assessed on 5 items (excluding food preparation
#   Modern practice: Often assess all 8 for all genders
# Validity: Correlates with cognitive measures and predicts institutionalization
# Gender Considerations: Original scale had gender-specific items; modern usage more egalitarian
# Relationship to ADLs: IADLs decline before ADLs in dementia progression
#   d360 = Using communication devices and techniques
#   d620 = Acquisition of goods and services
#   d6400 = Washing and drying clothes and garments
# Usage for WP-02: These IADLs will be mapped to FAST stages (particularly stages 3-5) to determine which IADLs are impaired at each stage
# Note: IADLs are generally impaired before ADLs in dementia progression
iadl_name: with impairment beginning at FAST stage 3
